derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin incrementum, from the stem of increscere 'grow' (see increase)

entry.def: An increment in something or in the value of something is an amount by which it increases.

example.ex: The average yearly increment in labour productivity in industry was 4.5 per cent...
example.tran: 工业劳动生产率年平均增长 4.5%。

example.ex: Each increment of knowledge tells us more of our world.
example.tran: 知识的点滴增长都会增进我们对世界的认知。

entry.tran: (某一固定时期后自动的)加薪
entry.def: An increment is an amount by which your salary automatically increases after a fixed period of time.

example.ex: Many teachers qualify for an annual increment.
example.tran: 许多老师都有资格获得每年的加薪。

means.word_mean: 1. a process of becoming larger or longer or more numerous or more important;
2. the amount by which something increases;

sentences.sentence: "they proposed an increase of 15 percent in the fare"
